question.title: Best practices for breaking down long methods and modularizing large features in Spring Boot
question.body:
I’m working on refactoring a legacy codebase with a method that’s grown to several hundred lines.
The method mixes many responsibilities and is difficult to maintain.
Because the codebase is old, I have constraints on changing the existing structure and public APIs.
What’s a good approach to modularizing this method into smaller, well-defined functional blocks?

answers.body:
Adding transparency (for development, Q&A or even client)

One costly technique for making the software more valuable is to create additíonal accompaning meta-information, a meta-protocol, on how results are derived. With protocolling documentation.

If you already doing logging for traceability, that would be just an extra step. Then in every process you could add an administrative info button to display how results are derived, the pipeline of value states, and rules applied.

Similar pieces of code so may be tell how to refactor parts. Planning and communicating the refactoring and the progress are so easier.

HOWEVER that is when you have a really large mess. Several hundred lines is not that much. Refactoring itself cannot be treated reasonably mature in stackoverflow here. Sorry.
